text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..*ExtensionA logic definition used in the measure
extension:libraryName 1..1ExtensionWhich library
url 1..1uri"libraryName"
value[x] 0..1stringValue of extension
extension:name 1..1ExtensionWhich definition
url 1..1uri"name"
value[x] 0..1stringValue of extension
extension:statement 1..1ExtensionComplete declaration statement
url 1..1uri"statement"
value[x] 0..1stringValue of extension
extension:displaySequence 0..1ExtensionWhat order?
url 1..1uri"displaySequence"
value[x] 0..1integerValue of extension
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/us/cqfmeasures/StructureDefinition/cqfm-logicDefinition"
value[x] 0..0

Documentation for this format

name: CQFMLogicDefinition
title: CQFM Logic Definition
description: Defines a logic definition used by the measure.
purpose: A computable measure must specify all definitions used by the measure in order to provide a complete, human-readable narrative for the measure.

element.short: A logic definition used in the measure
element.definition: Defines a logic definition used by the measure.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: The name of the library that contains this definition. This is the library name, not the library alias within any particular library usage, and SHOULD be the fully qualified name of the library (i.e. namespace included).

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html) for a list).

element.definition: The complete declaration statement for the definition. For example, `define "Initial Population": [Encounter: "Inpatient"] E where duration in days of E.period > 2`.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A logic definition used in the measure
element.definition: Defines a logic definition used by the measure.

The name of the library that contains this definition. This is the library name, not the library alias within any particular library usage, and SHOULD be the fully qualified name of the library (i.e. namespace included).
The name of the definition, e.g. Initial Population. For function definitions, this SHOULD include the function parameters (e.g. "Measure Observation"(Encounter Encounter)).
The complete declaration statement for the definition. For example, `define "Initial Population": [Encounter: "Inpatient"] E where duration in days of E.period > 2`.
An integer value indicating the order in which this definition should be displayed in any human readable representation.
